definition:
1. Of or pertaining to stone; as, lithic architecture. 2. (Med.)  Pertaining to the formation of uric-acid concretions (stone) in the bladder and other parts of the body; as, lithic diathesis. LIthic acid (Old Med. Chem.), uric acid. See Uric acid, under Uric.

A medicine which tends to prevent stone in the bladder.

Pertaining to or denoting lithium or some of its compounds. Frankland.
